pageContext.claim: “The Fake News Media, just like Election time 2016, is bringing up my Taxes & all sorts of other nonsense with illegally obtained information & only bad intent. I paid many millions of dollars in taxes but was entitled, like everyone else, to depreciation & tax credits.”
pageContext.analysis: In response to a New York Times expose, Trump claims he has paid millions in taxes but his statements have no credibility unless he releases his tax returns. "Donald J. Trump paid $750 in federal income taxes the year he won the presidency. In his first year in the White House, he paid another $750," the Times reported after obtaining two decades of tax-return data. "He had paid no income taxes at all in 10 of the previous 15 years — largely because he reported losing much more money than he made." Trump has tried to explain away the $750 by calling it a "filing fee," but there is no such thing in the tax code. The Times reported that the $750 figure was on line 56 of Form 1040, which is for the amount of income tax that’s due.
